turns.speaker: LATEESHA
turns.text: Where are you? INT. CHEVY SUBURBAN -- NEXT Claremont is behind the Wheel of a BLACK CHEVY SUBURBAN. He pulls into the Texaco parking lot.

turns.speaker: CLAREMONT
turns.text: I'm pulling up right now. Evacuate the fucking van! Plans have changed! <b> EXT. TEXACO STATION -- NEXT

turns.speaker: CLAREMONT
turns.text: You motherfuckin' Tino. You fucked us so bad.

turns.speaker: LATEESHA
turns.text: I fucked up. You can't help your greedy black lying ass from trying to get everything. All you've done is put a death sentence on Meeka.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Claremont, you're a chubby chaser.

turns.speaker: CLAREMONT
turns.text: You white folks don't understand the natural beauty of a woman's figure. Those are birthing hips. More cushion for the pushin'.

turns.speaker: CLAREMONT
turns.text: Did you get all four?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Yep.

turns.speaker: CLAREMONT
turns.text: Deliver them to the Needles DMV. Sundown at the Sam Kinison monument.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: We need hostages. Celebrity hostages. Just in case this gets ugly. EXT. NEVADA DESERT -- LATER ON The Cast Winnebago drives through the desert.

turns.speaker: CLAREMONT
turns.text: The combination code is tattooed on his right arm. You'll never get inside Edna Fender's safe without the code-breaker on that arm. INT. CAST WINNEBAGO -- NEXT Domino rides shotgun with her CELL PHONE to her ear.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: CLAREMONT
turns.text: The money exchange will take place at Top of the World at the Stratosphere. Get there at exactly midnight.

turns.speaker: TARYN
turns.text: Ms. Harvey... my name is Taryn Miles. I'm a criminal psychologist working for the FBI. I'm here to ask you a few questions.

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: Here's the part where I'm supposed to get all defensive and say... 'not until I speak with my attorney.'

turns.speaker: TARYN
turns.text: The driver's name was Locus Fender. We know that he was in on the heist. INT. ARMORED CAR -- NEXT LOCUS FENDER is behind the wheel of the armored car. His unshaven, disheveled appearance looks totally out of place in his security uniform. INT. VEGAS SECURITY LOCKDOWN -- NIGHT Taryn is now scrawling notes on a pad.

turns.speaker: TARYN
turns.text: Where is the money?

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: TARYN
turns.text: I think that you're lying. I think you know exactly where the money is.

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: You're trying to scare me into falsely incriminating myself... and it's not working. I said I'd tell you everything I know. You and your friends behind the mirror.

turns.speaker: TARYN
turns.text: Is it true that you were hired to track down and capture the thieves... and then deliver them to Drake Bishop... owner of the Stratosphere Hotel & Casino?

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: TARYN
turns.text: You then learned where the thieves had hidden the money... and at the instructions of your employer went to retrieve it yourself.

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: He sent us out to the Fender Compound. Out in the desert near the Chicken Ranch.

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: He's a reality television producer. His name is Mark Weiss.

turns.speaker: TARYN
turns.text: Mr. Weiss was very generous in turning over some video tapes to the FBI. There's lots of footage of you. We know everything.  If you don't come clean... the information on these tapes could send you to prison for a very long time.

turns.speaker: TARYN
turns.text: Are you aware that Lateesha Rodriguez has been running a counterfeit driver's license racket?

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: That's the rumor on the street.

turns.speaker: TARYN
turns.text: What was your business with Lateesha that day?

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: We needed to verify some bond certificates for Claremont. She pushes stuff through the system for us... helps us track down perps for a kick back. It's all legal. INT. MUSTANG CONVERTIBLE -- [FLASHBACK] DAY

turns.speaker: TARYN
turns.text: You drove Lateesha's daughter to school... then dropped her off at the DMV. Why?

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: Her car was in the shop.

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: The bitch was bluffing. There were no dupe tapes. If there were... they'd have shown them to me by now.

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: Show me the tapes. I want to see them.

turns.speaker: TARYN
turns.text: Not yet. INT. CAST WINNEBAGO -- NEXT Alf pulls onto the 15 FREEWAY.

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: Take us to Vegas.

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: Now the bitch was getting personal.

turns.speaker: TARYN
turns.text: That's the only way you can cope with the route your life has taken. The fact that you made the choice to pursue this life- style... much to the chagrin of your mother... who is so clearly ashamed of you.  Imagine her shame when we cart you off to prison because you won't just tell the truth about what really happened. <b> EXT. NEVADA DESERT -- DAY FOR NIGHT [MESCALINE TRIP]

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: Take us to Vegas. EXT. DESERT ROAD -- DAY The crew rides in the back of the Wanderer's truck toward Vegas. INT. VEGAS SECURITY LOCKDOWN -- NIGHT Domino stares at Taryn as she returns to the table.

turns.speaker: TARYN
turns.text: This is your last chance. Tell us everything you know.

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: Do you want know the real reason why I became a bounty hunter?

turns.speaker: TARYN
turns.text: No. Please enlighten me.

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: I became a bounty hunter because of cunts like you.  I remember all the cunts in high school who were mean to me. Eventually... they all grew up to be just like you. Angry and bitter because they peaked early... and now they're stuck in some dead end marriage... or worse yet... an unfulfilling job that keeps them from meeting a man.

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: That's my best friend. His name is Choco. He's always fancied me... but too shy to ever do anything about it.

turns.speaker: EDNA
turns.text: Chi-Chi!  CHI-CHI!

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: Chi-Chi has gone to doggie heaven, bitch!

turns.speaker: EDNA
turns.text: Is that you, Domino?

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: Nice to see you again, Edna.

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: HE'S STILL ALIVE, EDNA!

turns.speaker: EDNA
turns.text: PROVE IT!

turns.speaker: EDNA
turns.text: LOCUS! BABY... I'M HERE!

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: Turn over your weapon, Edna!

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: Is that the decoder?

turns.speaker: EDNA
turns.text: Yeah. INT. FENDER HOUSE -- MOMENTS LATER

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: Either this was some kind of set up... or the First Ladies got scared... decided to pull out and cut their losses.

turns.speaker: EDNA
turns.text: Fuck 'em. Their loss is our gain. Put the money in the safe until we hear from Claremont. <b>

turns.speaker: EDNA
turns.text: Cock-fuckers are gonna pay.

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: Mescaline. INT. CAST WINNEBAGO -- NIGHT Domino and the others are all drinking coffee. Alf stares out through the windshield at the GLOW of Vegas in the distance.

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: After dad passed on, Mum's agenda was to hit the town and find another husband with a boatload of cash. INT. LONDON APARTMENT -- EVENING Sophie is dolled up for a night on the town... CLEAVAGE spilling out of her cocktail dress. Domino is feeding her pet GOLDFISH. "THUNDERBIRDS" plays on the television.

turns.speaker: SOPHIE
turns.text: Be kind to your sitter.

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: Everything. It is a ghastly existence.

turns.speaker: SOPHIE
turns.text: Why must you fight... everything that is normal? You are blessed with such beauty. Life could be so easy... if only you allowed yourself to fit the mold.

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: The mold? I am living among these crypto-fascist Orange County cunts... with daddy's BMW and the boob job... just waiting to implode.

turns.speaker: SOPHIE
turns.text: Crypto-fascist? Who talks like this?!

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: I refuse to turn out like them. Twenty-one years old and they're already looking for a husband.  Stupid fucking cunts with no self- esteem. They let the boys control their lives. Not me.

turns.speaker: SOPHIE
turns.text: Must you use that awful word?

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: Cunt.

turns.speaker: SOPHIE
turns.text: Stop it.

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: Cunt.

turns.speaker: SOPHIE
turns.text: I said stop it.

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: Cunt. It's just a word. Why does everyone in this fucking country get their knickers in a twist by the slightest bit of indecent conversation?

turns.speaker: SOPHIE
turns.text: So who is this Choko? Is he your new boyfriend?

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: It's Choco. And he's not my boyfriend. He's a bounty hunter.

turns.speaker: SOPHIE
turns.text: Whatever. He's a criminal. And this Ed Martin character is a complete loser.

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: He used to date Pat Benatar!

turns.speaker: SOPHIE
turns.text: God help us. God help us all.

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: It was the beginning of the end.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Don't fuck with us, Edna! There are at least three more limbs where that one came from!

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: I can certainly think of one more!

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: My real father was an actor. He died when I was a little girl.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Wow. Laurence Harvey. He knew Frank Sinatra?  I knew Frank.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: What the... who is this bitch? EXT. HAWTHORNE COMMUNITY CENTER -- PARKING LOT -- NEXT Ed and Choco exit the El Camino just as Domino retrieves her knife from the windshield. She grips it in her right hand... threatening them.

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: Where the fuck do you think you're going?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: You want to be a bounty hunter. Why does a pretty little thing like you want to be a bounty hunter?

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: Because I want justice. I want to help put these sleazebags back in jail where they belong.  And I want to have a little fun.

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: You can save that Pretty Woman shit. The name is Domino.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Domino. Do you have a last name... Domino?

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: No last names. Just Domino. The less you know about me the better, okay?

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: So Ed. What did you do before you became a bounty hunter?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I was a musician.

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: Really? Did you play in a band?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Yeah. I played base guitar for Pat Benatar.

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: I... love... Pat Benatar.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Yeah?! Well... I loved her too.

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: Oh my God... you mean... the two of you dated?!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: We dated off and on for two years. But life on the road is tough. The pressure of the tour... relationships within a band... sometimes it leads to jealousy.

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: How did you meet Choco?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I found him pan-handling on Third Street Promenade. Took him under my wing. We been hunting together ever since.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: What the fuck is your problem? Bitch!! INT. SOPHIE TROMAS MANSION -- KITCHEN -- DAY Domino is loading her GUN at the kitchen table as Sophie serves breakfast. Domino wolfs it down.

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: Mum was terrified for me. She didn't approve of my lifestyle one bit.

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: I was asleep in mum's guest house. INT. SOPHIE THOMAS MANSION -- BEDROOM -- NEXT Domino is asleep in bed. The TELEPHONE rings.

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: We gotta go to work, Domino.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Can you tell?

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: You're wearing eyeliner. You look like a queen.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Cool it, Choco.

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: YOU'RE UNDER ARREST.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Everyone... please give Domino her space. Step back, please!

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: You have sixty seconds... here's the question...  Which one of you is Frances?

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: Where are the bond certificates for the First Ladies?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: There are no bond certificates.

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: What do you mean? Claremont didn't provide them?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: No. What's the big deal?

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: Something is going down. Something bad.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Claremont said we deliver the First Ladies in Needles. Then we go home. No questions asked.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: What did he say about the arm?

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: He said... take his right arm.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Make us a pot of coffee, Edna. It's gonna be a long night. EXT. FENDER COMPOUND -- MOMENTS LATER Edna stands next to her MAIMED SON near the burning barrels as they watch the Winnebago drive off into the desert. Locus is sobbing... latching onto his mother's sweater.

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: Turned out Edna. had one last trick up her sleeve. INT. FENDER COMPOUND -- KITCHEN -- [FLASHBACK] TEN MINUTES AGO

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: We are so fucked.

turns.speaker: DOMINO
turns.text: Then so be it. If you believe what that Indian said we were fucked either way.

turns.speaker: ZIERING
turns.text: Uhhh... I have no idea what you just said.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: SPEAK ENGLISH! JESUS CHRIST WE'RE ON TELEVISION HERE!

turns.speaker: ZIERING
turns.text: Three tours? Isn't that... twelve years?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Son, with the exception of Spring Break in Tijuana, have you ever ventured outside of California?

turns.speaker: ZIERING
turns.text: Many times.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Do you know where Danang is?

turns.speaker: ZIERING
turns.text: Not really.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: ...THEN SHUT THE FUCK UP!

turns.speaker: ZIERING
turns.text: We're late.

turns.speaker: GREEN
turns.text: Fucking Map Quest. Never again. EXT. DOWNTOWN GARAGE ROOFTOP -- NEXT Ziering and Green approach a LARGE TENT. The WINNEBAGO is parked off to the side. Alf is inside... doing something with a WELDER on the front of the RV.

turns.speaker: ZIERING
turns.text: They need to get the introduction on camera. Just play along, alright?

turns.speaker: GREEN
turns.text: They're gonna edit it together out of sequence so it's more exciting. <b> EXT. BEVERLY HILLS -- LATER ON

turns.speaker: ZIERING
turns.text: Listen, dick-fuck. I had a good run while it lasted. Now I've got ten million in the bank. I'll never have to work again for the rest of my life.

turns.speaker: GREEN
turns.text: And he used to fuck a Playboy centerfold every night.

turns.speaker: ZIERING
turns.text: Twice a night, sometimes.

turns.speaker: ZIERING
turns.text: We didn't sign on for this shit.  Fuck! This shit is intense. I need to call my agent.

turns.speaker: GREEN
turns.text: Just shut up and do what they say. They're gonna kill us if we don't, Ian.

turns.speaker: WEISS
turns.text: Get Cynthia on the line. They changed the fucking font.

turns.speaker: KIMMIE
turns.text: Okay.  Domino Harvey is here.

turns.speaker: WEISS
turns.text: Send her through to the conference room. <b> INT. FOX TELEVISION STUDIOS -- LOBBY -- NEXT

turns.speaker: KIMMIE
turns.text: This could break new ground in terms of traditional host models. It's self-reflexive reality television.

turns.speaker: WEISS
turns.text: Your theory is valid... in theory.

turns.speaker: KIMMIE
turns.text: We can't lose focus of Domino's journey, Mark.

turns.speaker: WEISS
turns.text: We're covered on legal with that, right?

turns.speaker: KIMMIE
turns.text: In theory.

turns.speaker: KIMMIE
turns.text: Fast and or furious.

turns.speaker: WEISS
turns.text: But real. This is gritty. Like Cassavetes.

turns.speaker: KIMMIE
turns.text: Exactly. Why don't you leave the guns behind this time? Go in with only batons, brass knuckles, and numb-chucks.

turns.speaker: KIMMIE
turns.text: This girl is going to be a star. She just tells it like it is.

turns.speaker: WEISS
turns.text: We should sign her to a talent holding deal. <b> INT. KEG HOUSE -- FRANCES' ROOM -- NEXT

turns.speaker: KIMMIE
turns.text: Where is Domino?

turns.speaker: WEISS
turns.text: She went up to her room.

turns.speaker: LASHANDRA
turns.text: You were good.

turns.speaker: LASHINDRA
turns.text: Real good.

turns.speaker: LASHANDRA
turns.text: Ain't nobody gonna call me a bitch without some payback.

turns.speaker: LASHINDRA
turns.text: Nobody.

turns.speaker: LASHANDRA
turns.text: Gotta strip/ Gotta give some lip/ Gotta make my tip/ But keep yo hands to yourself - Cuz you ain't touching these tits.

turns.speaker: LASHINDRA
turns.text: House is a wreck/ Gotta collect my check/ Gotta perfume my neck/ But keep yo hands off the weave cuz this black bitch don't suck the dick.

turns.speaker: LASHANDRA
turns.text: Just like Billy Ocean says. When the going gets tough...

turns.speaker: LASHINDRA
turns.text: The tough get going.

turns.speaker: LASHANDRA
turns.text: Meeka's white blood cell count is dropping fast.

turns.speaker: LASHINDRA
turns.text: Real fast.

turns.speaker: BUGGIN' OUT
turns.text: How you be?

turns.speaker: RADIO RAHEEM
turns.text: I be.  I'm living large.

turns.speaker: BUGGIN' OUT
turns.text: Is that the only tape you got?

turns.speaker: RADIO RAHEEM
turns.text: You don't like Public Enemy?  It's the dope shit.

turns.speaker: BUGGIN' OUT
turns.text: I like 'em, but you don't play anything else.

turns.speaker: RADIO RAHEEM
turns.text: I don't like anything else.

turns.speaker: BUGGIN' OUT
turns.text: Check this out.  Y'know Sal's.

turns.speaker: RADIO RAHEEM
turns.text: Yeah, I know dat motherfucker.

turns.speaker: BUGGIN' OUT
turns.text: I'm trying to organize a boycott of Sal's pizza joint.  Ya see what I'm saying?

turns.speaker: RADIO RAHEEM
turns.text: I almost had to yoke him this afternoon.  Tell me, tell me, Radio Raheem, to turn my music down. Didn't even say please.  Who the fuck he think he is?  Don Corleone and shit.

turns.speaker: BUGGIN' OUT
turns.text: He makes all his money off us Black people and I don't see nuthin' but Italians all up in there, Sylvester Stallone and motherfuckers.  Ya see what I'm saying, homeboy?

turns.speaker: RADIO RAHEEM
turns.text: Talk to me.

turns.speaker: BUGGIN' OUT
turns.text: We shouldn't buy a single slice, spend a single penny in that motherfucker till some people of color are put up in there.

turns.speaker: RADIO RAHEEM
turns.text: That's what I'm talkin' 'bout. That's what I'm talkin' 'bout.

turns.speaker: BUGGIN' OUT
turns.text: You got my back.

turns.speaker: RADIO RAHEEM
turns.text: Ya back is got.

turns.speaker: BUGGIN' OUT
turns.text: My brother.

turns.speaker: RADIO RAHEEM
turns.text: My brother.

turns.speaker: BUGGIN' OUT
turns.text: Yo!

turns.speaker: CLIFTON
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: BUGGIN' OUT
turns.text: You almost knocked me down.  The word is "excuse me."

turns.speaker: CLIFTON
turns.text: Excuse me.  I'm very sorry.

turns.speaker: BUGGIN' OUT
turns.text: Not only did you knock me down, you stepped on my new white Air Jordans that I just bought and that's all you can say, "Excuse me?"

turns.speaker: BUGGIN' OUT
turns.text: I'll fuck you up quick two times.

turns.speaker: BUGGIN' OUT
turns.text: Who told you to step on my sneakers? Who told you to walk on my side of the block?  Who told you to be in my neighborhood?

turns.speaker: CLIFTON
turns.text: I own a brownstone on this block.

turns.speaker: BUGGIN' OUT
turns.text: Who told you to buy a brownstone on my block, in my neighborhood on my side of the street?

turns.speaker: BUGGIN' OUT
turns.text: What do you want to live in a Black neighborhood for?  Motherfuck gentrification.

turns.speaker: CLIFTON
turns.text: I'm under the assumption that this is a free country and one can live where he pleases.

turns.speaker: CLIFTON
turns.text: I'm gonna leave now.

turns.speaker: BUGGIN' OUT
turns.text: If I wasn't a righteous Black man you'd be in serious trouble. SERIOUS.

turns.speaker: JADE
turns.text: That's not even true.  I just want a slice.

turns.speaker: BUGGIN' OUT
turns.text: Jade, you don't know this, but I'm organizing a boycott of Sal's Famous Pizzeria.

turns.speaker: JADE
turns.text: What did he do this time?

turns.speaker: BUGGIN' OUT
turns.text: Y'know all those pictures he has hanging on the Wall of Fame?

turns.speaker: JADE
turns.text: So?

turns.speaker: BUGGIN' OUT
turns.text: Have you noticed something about them?

turns.speaker: BUGGIN' OUT
turns.text: Every single one of those pictures is somebody Italian.

turns.speaker: JADE
turns.text: And?

turns.speaker: BUGGIN' OUT
turns.text: And I--we--want some Black people up.

turns.speaker: JADE
turns.text: Did you ask Sal?

turns.speaker: BUGGIN' OUT
turns.text: Yeah, I asked him.  I don't want nobody in there, nobody spending good money in Sal's.  He should get no mo' money from the community till he puts some Black faces up on that motherfucking wall.

turns.speaker: JADE
turns.text: Buggin' Out, I don't mean to be disrespectful, but you can really direct your energies in a more useful way.

turns.speaker: BUGGIN' OUT
turns.text: So, in other words, you are not down.

turns.speaker: JADE
turns.text: I'm down, but for a worthwhile cause.

turns.speaker: BUGGIN' OUT
turns.text: Jade, I still love you.

turns.speaker: BUGGIN' OUT
turns.text: How much?

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: You come in here at least three times a day.  You a retard?  A buck fifty.

turns.speaker: BUGGIN' OUT
turns.text: Damn, Sal, put some more cheese on that motherfucker.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: Extra cheese is two dollars. Y'know dat.

turns.speaker: BUGGIN' OUT
turns.text: Two dollars!  Forget it!

turns.speaker: BUGGIN' OUT
turns.text: Sal, that might be fine, you own this, but rarely do I see any Italian Americans eating in here. All I've ever seen is Black folks. So since we spend much money here, we do have some say.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: You a troublemaker?

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: Don't come back, either.

turns.speaker: BUGGIN' OUT
turns.text: Boycott Sal's.  Boycott Sal's.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: What did I tell ya 'bout dat noise?

turns.speaker: BUGGIN' OUT
turns.text: What did I tell ya 'bout dem pictures?

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: What da fuck!  Are you deaf?

turns.speaker: BUGGIN' OUT
turns.text: No, are you?  We want some Black people up on the Wall of Fame.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: Turn that JUNGLE MUSIC off.  We ain't in Africa.

turns.speaker: BUGGIN' OUT
turns.text: Why it gotta be about jungle music and Africa?

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: It's about turning that shit off and getting the fuck outta my pizzeria.

turns.speaker: BUGGIN' OUT
turns.text: Mookie.

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: BUGGIN' OUT
turns.text: How come you ain't got no brothers up?

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: Ask Sal.

turns.speaker: BUGGIN' OUT
turns.text: Sal, how come you ain't got no brothers up on the wall here?

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: Buggin' Out, I gotta work here.

turns.speaker: BUGGIN' OUT
turns.text: I'm cool.  I'm cool.

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: Come back in a week, it will be squashed.

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: You the man.

turns.speaker: BUGGIN' OUT
turns.text: You the man.

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: No, you the man.

turns.speaker: BUGGIN' OUT
turns.text: No.  I'm just a struggling Black man trying to keep my dick hard in a cruel and harsh world.

turns.speaker: BUGGIN' OUT
turns.text: It's so nice to see a family hanging out together.

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: We're not hanging out.  I'm being escorted back to work.

turns.speaker: COCONUT SID
turns.text: You a dumb-ass simple motherfucker. Where did you read that?

turns.speaker: ML
turns.text: Don't worry about it.  But when it happens and I'm in my boat and ya black ass is drowning, don't ask me to throw you a lifesaver either.

turns.speaker: COCONUT SID
turns.text: As I was saying before we were so rudely interrupted by the finest.

turns.speaker: ML
turns.text: What was you saying?

turns.speaker: COCONUT SID
turns.text: Make it plain.

turns.speaker: ML
turns.text: OK, but listen up.  I'm gonna break it down.

turns.speaker: COCONUT SID
turns.text: It's been about a year.

turns.speaker: ML
turns.text: A motherfucking year off the motherfucking boat and got a good business in our neighborhood occupying a building that had been boarded up for longer than I care to remember and I've been here a long time.

turns.speaker: COCONUT SID
turns.text: How long?

turns.speaker: ML
turns.text: Too long!  Too long.  Now for the life of me, I haven't been able to figger this out.  Either dem Koreans are geniuses or we Blacks are dumb.

turns.speaker: ML
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: COCONUT SID
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: ML
turns.text: What can you say?

turns.speaker: COCONUT SID
turns.text: I don't know how he does it.

turns.speaker: COCONUT SID
turns.text: Squash it.

turns.speaker: ML
turns.text: I just wanted to know who named ya Sweet Dick Willie?

turns.speaker: MOTHER SISTER
turns.text: The evil eye doesn't work on me.

turns.speaker: DA MAYOR
turns.text: Mother Sister, you've been talkin' 'bout me the last eighteen years. What have I ever done to you?

turns.speaker: MOTHER SISTER
turns.text: You're a drunk fool.

turns.speaker: DA MAYOR
turns.text: Besides that.  Da Mayor don't bother nobody.  Nobody don't bother Da Mayor but you.  Da Mayor just mind his business.  I love everybody. I even love you.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SISTER
turns.text: Hold your tongue.  You don't have that much love.

turns.speaker: DA MAYOR
turns.text: One day you'll be nice to me.  We might both be dead and buried, but you'll be nice.  At least civil.

turns.speaker: DA MAYOR
turns.text: I didn't know you had such beautiful hair.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SISTER
turns.text: Fool, there's a lot in this world you don't know.

turns.speaker: DA MAYOR
turns.text: I'm not stopping.  I'm on my way.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SISTER
turns.text: That was a foolish act, but it was brave.  That chile owes you his life.

turns.speaker: DA MAYOR
turns.text: I wasn't trying to be a hero.  I saw what was about to happen and I reacted, didn't even think.  If I did, I might not have done it in second thought.  Da Mayor is an old man, haven't run that fast in years.

turns.speaker: DA MAYOR
turns.text: I went from first to home on a bunt single, scored the winning run, the bottom of the ninth, two out, August 1, 1939, Snow Hill, Alabama.  Maybe I should be heroic more often.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SISTER
turns.text: Maybe you shouldn't.  Don't get happy.  This changes nothing between you and me.  You did a good thing and Mother Sister wanted to thank you for it.

turns.speaker: DA MAYOR
turns.text: I thank you.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SISTER
turns.text: You're welcome.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SISTER
turns.text: Good morning.

turns.speaker: DA MAYOR
turns.text: Is it a good morning?

turns.speaker: MOTHER SISTER
turns.text: Yes indeed.  You almost got yourself killed last night.

turns.speaker: DA MAYOR
turns.text: I've done that before.

turns.speaker: DA MAYOR
turns.text: Where did you sleep?

turns.speaker: MOTHER SISTER
turns.text: I didn't.

turns.speaker: DA MAYOR
turns.text: I hope the block is still standing.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SISTER
turns.text: We're still standing.

turns.speaker: DA MAYOR
turns.text: Mookie.

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: Gotta go.

turns.speaker: DA MAYOR
turns.text: C'mere, Doctor.

turns.speaker: DA MAYOR
turns.text: Doctor, this is Da Mayor talkin'.

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: OK.  OK.

turns.speaker: DA MAYOR
turns.text: Doctor, always try to do the right thing.

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: That's it?

turns.speaker: DA MAYOR
turns.text: That's it.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Eddie Lovell.

turns.speaker: DA MAYOR
turns.text: How old are you?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Ten.

turns.speaker: DA MAYOR
turns.text: What makes Sammy run?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: My name is Eddie.

turns.speaker: DA MAYOR
turns.text: What makes Sammy run?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I said my name is Eddie Lovell.

turns.speaker: DA MAYOR
turns.text: Relax, Eddie, I want you to go to the corner store.  How much will it cost me?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: How would I know how much it's gonna cost if I don't know what I'm buying?

turns.speaker: DA MAYOR
turns.text: Eddie, you're too smart for your own britches.  Listen to me.  How much do you want to run to the store for Da Mayor?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Fifty cents.

turns.speaker: DA MAYOR
turns.text: You got a deal.

turns.speaker: JADE
turns.text: Don't you have enough sense not to bother people when they're sleeping?

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: Wake up!

turns.speaker: JADE
turns.text: Wake up?  Saturday is the lone day I get to sleep late.

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: It's gonna be hot today.

turns.speaker: JADE
turns.text: Good!  Leave me alone when I'm sleeping.  I'm gonna get a lock on my door, to keep ya ass outta here.

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: Don't ya love ya brother Mookie anymore?  I loves ya, Jade.

turns.speaker: JADE
turns.text: Do me a favor.  Go to work.

turns.speaker: MOOKIE
turns.text: Later.  Gotta get paid.
